title: Behavior of a function based on its derivatives

content.question: For x > 0, f is a function such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41EA@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>″</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>ln</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@449B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following is true?

choices.label: f is decreasing for x > 1, and the graph of f is concave down for x > e.
f is decreasing for x > 1, and the graph of f is concave up for x > e.
f is increasing for x > 1, and the graph of f is concave down for x > e.
f is increasing for x > 1, and the graph of f is concave up for x > e.
f is increasing for 0 < x < e, and the graph of f is concave down for 0<x<e 3/2 .

content.answer: f is increasing for x > 1, and the graph of f is concave down for x > e.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
